body:
server is a bad name for a package, client is also a bad name for a package.

On Fri, Jul 22, 2016 at 10:01 AM, Minux Ma <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Perhaps it's better to point out a few packages that really benefit from
> refactoring with the help of type aliases. I think net/http is one of them.
>
> If we could break it into multiple internal packages, say, one for common
> logic, one for client and another for server, I'd expect we can properly
> vendor http2 into net/http without the current bundle hack. (search
> "[golang-dev] http -> http2 -> http import cycle" for the email.)
>
> â€”
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
